name: Mediterranean Grilled Pork Chops
author: STORMY3600
summary: Very simple and oh, so good!  Best of all, can be made from ingredients you probably already have in your pantry.  My favorite way to do pork chops.  Hope you enjoy this recipe as much as I do.
ingredients: 4  bone-in pork rib chops (not pork loin chops) - at least 1/2-inch thick
directions: In a bowl, mix together the sage, rosemary, thyme, fennel seed, sugar, bay leaf, and salt until thoroughly combined
Rub both sides of the pork chops with the herb mixture, and coat them with olive oil
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate
Grill the chops until they are browned, show good grill marks, and the meat is no longer pink inside, about 4 minutes per side
An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a chop should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
